BeagleBone Capes

BeagleBone is a credit-card sized open hardware expandable Linux computer that connects with the Internet and runs software such as Android 4.0 and Ubuntu. It allows developers to evaluate Sitara™ AM335x ARM® Cortex™-A8 processors with a single cable and under 10-second Linux boot; enabling development in less than 5 minutes. Adding cape plug-in boards to the popular BeagleBone computer allows hobbyists, makers and developers to quickly and easily augment BeagleBone's capabilities with LCD screens, motor control and battery power, as well as the ability to create their own circuits.

Available now are over 20 capes for DVI-D, VGA, LCD, motor control, prototyping, battery and more. We've engaged several open hardware developers for many other interesting sensor, control and wired/wireless networking boards and I fully expect there to be more than 100 on the market in the next year.

Take a look at the list of registered cape concepts and register your own. You can purchase some of the capes via the CircuitCo BeagleBone Cape page which attempts to log all of the capes currently available for sale:

BeagleBoneCapes.com
